benefits: more opinion, can be shorter, less detailed processing the research literature
limitations: can be less compelling without some specific evidence listed and is difficult to repeat

elements: summary, insights, next steps, explanation of how studies were selected in the review, can have counts of ideas tested
benefits: more specific, can be repeated, and can be more compelling
limitations: need to keep track of how you selected papers, need to sort through papers in more detail in addition to capturing main ideas

elements: all of above possible but must also include an assessment of the strength of evidence of each study included in the synthesis
benefits: gold standard, reader can get a sense of how effective a treatment or intervention is relative to another
limitations: need to extract means or measures of efficacy with sample sizes or variance from each study
